job_desc:
About the job

Hi Job Seeker,




Tejas Networks is looking for Hardware Board Design Engineer for our team based in Bangalore.

If interested, kindly share your updated resume.

Kindly find the JD and company details below.

Kindly provide some references.




About Tejas:

Tejas is a telecom equipment manufacturer company established in Year 2000 with a mission to innovate leading edge, high quality, and excellent telecommunication products for its customers. The company house more than 50 % of its work force in R&D, hired from reputed colleges like IITs and NITs, making a highly motivated and research-oriented team, which work relentlessly in pursuit of innovations, developing high-end optical networking equipment.




Profile:

Designation: Hardware Board Design Engineer

Location: Bangalore

Education: BE/ B-Tech (ECE) OR M-Tech

Experience: 2 to 5 years










Please find the JD below:




Job Description / Skills:

· Should have good experience in Board Hardware Design

· Knowledge of High-Speed Board Design

· Experience in designing with memories like DDR3 / DDR4 / RLDRAM / GDDR / NAND / NOR etc.

· Experience in designing with High-speed communication protocol like PCIe / SATA / USB3.0 / SGMII / SFP+ /10G/100G/

· Experience in designing with Low-speed protocol like I2C / SPI / UART.

· Familiarity in designing products conforming to worldwide EMC and safety standards

· Responsibilities include Schematic Capture, Component Selection, Library Creation and Guiding Board Layout

· Experience of working with Mentor Graphics Dx Designer and Cadence Allegro would be preferred

· Experience in working with complex ASSPs, Microprocessors/controllers and FPGAs

· Experience in designing Point of Load DC-DC converters would be preferred

· Experience in Signal Integrity / Power Integrity

· Experience in working in optical products would be preferred.

· Should have knowledge of PCB Materials and familiarity with stack-up design

· Knowledge of scripting (bash/Tcl /VB) would be an added advantage

· Knowledge of Verilog HDL would be an added advantage

· Should have excellent troubleshooting skills on Electrical / Electronic boards to find the root cause and to debug

· Should have worked on testing equipment like high-speed Oscilloscope, Network analyzers, spectrum analyzers etc.

· Experience in working on synchronization and knowledge of syncE/1588 are added advantage
skills: ['Printed Circuit Board (PCB) Design', 'Allegro', 'DDR3', 'I2C', 'Microprocessors', 'PCIe', 'Schematic Capture', 'Signal Integrity', 'Universal Asynchronous Receiver/Transmitter (UART)', 'Verilog']

job_title: IP Characterization & Modeling Engineer- Greater Noida
job_desc:
About the job

ST is hiring for IP Characterization & Modeling Engineer - Greater Noida only




Role & Responsibility

To develop and validate IPs EDA views & methodologies for various Foundation & Complex Analog Mixed Signal IPs (I/Os, PLLs, Sensors, Data Convertors & Complex AMS Phys..) for smooth integration in ASIC flow used by ST internal and external products divisions/customers.

Required Skills

Good understanding of digital design concepts & CMOS fundamentals
Can quickly understand the functional & physical specifications of IPs & Libraries.
Exposure to electrical characterization tools like Kronos/Liberate/Silicon Smart etc.
Knows the various formats of liberty file (NLDM, CCS, LVF, APL etc.)
Knows IPs different physical formats Layout/LEF/Abstract/GDS/CDL
Hands-on on Behavioral modeling (HDL) Language : Verilog or System Verilog
Good understanding of static timing analysis concepts using Prime Time or Tempus
Exposure to SI/PI tools & IBIS modeling is a plus.
Scripting Skills : Perl/Tcl/Python is a plus.




Experience – 3 to 8 Years




Regards

Talent Acquisition
skills: ['Analytical Skills', 'Characterization', 'Competitive Analysis', 'English', 'Italian', 'Marketing Communications', 'Microelectronics', 'Modeling', 'Presentation Skills', 'Semiconductors']

job_desc:
About the job
At Hitachi Energy our purpose is advancing a sustainable energy future for all. We bring power to our homes, schools, hospitals and factories. Join us and work with fantastic people, while learning and developing yourself on projects that have a real impact to our communities and society. Bring your passion, bring your energy, and be part of a global team that appreciates a simple truth: Diversity + Collaboration = Great Innovation




As an Associate project engineer, you will join an aspiring team that works with the HVDC Power transmission links. It is a diverse and independent job, within our project groups, with lots of responsibility and you will have great opportunities to develop your skills within HVDC. Our department is responsible for the C & P hardware design of HVDC system. This includes design, documentation, testing, supervising the installation and commissioning of the control and protection systems. Supporting and supervising on-site installation and commissioning around the world is an important part of our business offering.




Your responsibilities




Production of Integrated System Schematic / Plant Circuit Diagram.
Preparation of manufacturer documentation (GA, Scheme drawings, BoM) for control and protection panels / cubicles and junction / marshalling boxes.
Preparation of Cable Schedule & Termination details.
Able to Conduct Design Review meetings.
Exposure in Engineering Base (EBASE) tool for Cubicle design and Plant Circuit diagram.
Exposure in AC Control & Protection schemes.
Exposure / Basic Knowledge in International electrical (IEEE/IEC) Standards.
Closely interacting with project team and support the team for smooth execution of project.




Your background




Bachelor Degree BE/ B.Tech (Electrical and Electronics Engineering).
Should have minimum 2 to 5 years of experience in Substation control & protection design of HV/EHV substation projects.
Must have experience in Software Skills i.e. Windows and MS office, AutoCAD Electrical, Engineering Base,Hidraw.
Taking Initiative in engineering Process optimizations, standardization etc.
Ability to work independently maintaining excellent quality and optimized design in developing deliverables.




More about us




Hitachi Energy is a global technology leader that is advancing a sustainable energy future for all. We serve customers in the utility, industry and infrastructure sectors with innovative solutions and services across the value chain. Together with customers and partners, we pioneer technologies and enable the digital transformation required to accelerate the energy transition towards a carbon-neutral future. We are advancing the world’s energy system to become more sustainable, flexible and secure whilst balancing social, environmental and economic value. Hitachi Energy has a proven track record and unparalleled installed base in more than 140 countries. Headquartered in Switzerland, we employ around 40,000 people in 90 countries and generate business volumes of approximately $10 billion USD. www.hitachienergy.com




Publication date




2023-02-21




Reference Number




IN54692723_E1
skills: ['AutoCAD Electrical', 'Design Review', 'Electronic Engineering', 'HV', 'HVDC', 'Hardware Architecture', 'Hardware Design', 'IEEE', 'Schematic', 'Substation']

job_desc:
About the job
Driving Infinite Possibilities Within A Diversified, Global Organization

Advanced Hardware Engineer

Honeywell prides itself in excelling in a highly competitive market providing state of the art solution. The engineers in Honeywell constantly adapts and upgrades to latest and futuristic technology that keeps us ahead of time. Aspiration Detection is a highly advanced field fold fire detection providing early detection and waring in case of fire. These are cutting edge technology that needs highly skilled engineer who work with advanced signal processing algorithms, fast and accurate processing system and provide complete reliability with zero failure. As part of this motivated team, you are expected to work and excel in all the phase of product development starting from Idea conception to product

Key Responsibilities

Design and develop hardware products and systems, end to end product development experience is a must
Design, define, and simulate analog and digital circuits.
Conduct FMEAs, Reliability and other failure analysis of HW Design
Responsible for schematic design , CDR and change management if needed.
Layout Review and ensure conformance to IPC standards and relevant Honeywell guidelines
Responsible for new product transfer from R&D to production and provide related technical document.
Responsible for the hardware circuit problem solving and product design upgrade of the products that have been put into production
Co-work with local FW/SW/Testing team on system level issues through the project development
Co-ordinate with regulatory team for product certification
Co-ordinate with Manufacturing and setup production and test setups
Chip selection, Hardware debugging, Hardware simulation, Hardware test automation
Manage BOM and parts Obsolescence and address supply chain issues working with sourcing and factory
Drive ECN, Disposition Plan, CCB approvals
Co-work with worldwide hardware team, system team and Customer engineering team on the development status sync up, issue debugging
Recruit and Mentor Junior Engineer

WE VALUE

7 + Years in Schematic Design, Layout Design and Board Bring up
Experience in Camera Interfaces, Lidar sensors, related filters is an added advantage
Very Good experience in digital, analogue and mixed signal circuit design
Strong Product design capabilities from concept to System Architecture
Design for platform, manage and control BOM for optimal cost
Board Bring-Up and testing: Including Functional tests, System testing, Compliance to specification, Design Verification Test, Power/Timing analysis, Thermal analysis, EMI/EMC tests and SI analysis
Assist and support CAD team or design team in schematic designs and layout.
Good experience in EMI/EMC, ESD, FCC testing requirement
Experience in Power analysis, Power Supply selection, Voltage Regulator and Thermal Analysis.
Expertise in SMPS, linear power supplier, and OP Amp design
Should have experience in designing commercial and Industrial product preferably should have worked with MIL grade applications
Expert level experience in EDA Tools - Mentor Graphics, LT Spice/TINA
Should have good knowledge of IPC standards for PCB Layout design
Working knowledge in C and device drivers for broad bring up and design.
Experience in design using ARM based processors Ti, NXP, ST etc
Familiar with common bus such as I2C, UART, SPI, RS485, MODBUS, CAN, etc.
Good analytical skills
Team player with good communication skills
Ability to identify and troubleshoot hardware problems including field issue
Experience in RF design for wireless technologies such as Zigbee, Bluetooth, WIFI products.
Should be motivated to learn quickly and adapt.
Familiar with I2C, UART, SPI, RS485, MODBUS, CAN
Working knowledge in Microsoft tools, Jira or any project management tools
Working knowledge in code management tools like bit bucket, SVN etc
Good verbal and written communication skills
Strong Microsoft Office suite skills – MS Excel/MS Access/Etc.

YOU MUST HAVE

Bachelor's degree in Engineering in Electrical /Electronics Engineering
10+ years of Industrial experience Product Design

Additional Information

JOB ID: HRD191589
Category: Engineering
Location: Devarabisanahalli Village, KR Varturhobli,,East Taluk - Phase I,Bangalore,KARNATAKA,560103,India
Exempt
Engineering (GLOBAL)
skills: ['Printed Circuit Board (PCB) Design', 'Circuit', 'Circuit Design', 'Electromagnetic Interference (EMI)', 'Layout Design', 'Mixed-Signal Integrated Circuits', 'U.S. Federal Communications Commission (FCC)', 'Voltage', 'Voltage Regulator', 'ZigBee']

job_desc:
About the job
Job Description

Job Title:

Firmware Development Engineer

Location:

EIC-Pune

Position Summary:

As a firmware engineer working in the new product development group you will be responsible for a broad range of engineering tasks. Our mission is to deliver to the market highly reliable products for which Emerson is well known and our customers demand.

In support of that mission you will be responsible for rapid familiarization with embedded products, designing and development of new features, developing firmware for wireless communication like Bluetooth. This role requires a well-rounded skillset with the ability to work within an already defined architecture and the ability to design new architectures. You will be expected to document your work thoroughly and support our commitment to software quality by adhering to company best practices for software development. Design documentation using unambiguous tools such as UML are expected. Your code will be subjected to code reviews and will be required to conform to company coding standards. Unit testing and static analysis are also expected. Your development tasks will span feature design, implementation, verification and release.

This is an exciting opportunity for someone that likes to be continually challenged by working with new and unfamiliar hardware and tools.

Essential Job Functions:

Analyze, design, and implement solutions to requirements
Propose improvements to identified software inefficiencies and deficiencies
Utilize scopes, meters, power sources etc. as necessary to complete the task
Plan and architect a testing environment using existing tool chain for a given product
Participate in sprint planning sessions.
Identifies test cases necessary for verifying firmware requirements.
Implements or manages the implementation of test cases
Manage code changes using version control tools.
Participate in code reviews.
Execute or manage the execution of test cases
Log defects in project defined defect tracking tool
Read and follow relevant project engineering practice and engineering standards documents.


Education / Experience Required:

Bachelor of Science Computer Engineering, Electronics Engineering or Equivalent Engineering with a focus on programming
Prior embedded development experience is a must with ability to understand hardware interfaces and work with hardware engineering team to analyze, troubleshoot technical challenges.
Ability to work in a global engineering environment


Knowledge / Skills / Abilities:

Knowledge and experience with 8, 16, and 32 bit Micro-controllers
Knowledge and experience with agile development methodologies
Knowledge and experience with distributed version control such as (GIT, Mercurial)
Expert programming skills with C / C++ compilers and linkers
Standalone and RTOS based firmware development experience.
Experience developing low level driver interfaces for I2C/SPI/UART/Display/
6-8 years of embedded firmware development experience for an embedded product
Strong analytical and debugging skills
Knowledge or ability to learn requirements management database tools such as (Jama)
Ability to participate in a team environment
Must have a commitment to quality
Methodical problem-solving skills are needed
skills: ['Bluetooth', 'Database Tools', 'Design Documents', 'Firmware', 'Hardware Engineering', 'Mercurial', 'Software Quality', 'Test Cases', 'Unified Modeling Language (UML)', 'Universal Asynchronous Receiver/Transmitter (UART)']

job_desc:
About the job
Job Description

Job Description for Lead (Senior Engineer) - DCS:

Job Description

Planning and management

Along with the Project Manager, review the project scope and schedule.
Plan the project execution including planning of materials, design and development schedule and resources.
Assist Project Manager to prepare progress report for customer.
Prepare site commissioning plan which include schedule, detailed tasks order and materials logistics.
Coordinate work between multiple internal and external teams and disciplines.
Assist PM in reviewing project progress, cost control, scope identification and Risk management.


Customer relations

Be Primary contact with customer for all technical queries, clarifications and discussions.
Submit design documents to customer for review and approval. Manage customer expectations and promptly respond to comments.
Lead Factory Acceptance test with customer and work project team members to ensure all punch lists are closed in a timely manner.
Lead site commissioning activities, manage site teams, prepare progress reports to ensure smooth commissioning.


Technical delivery

Prepare technical solution concept to comply with project scope and optimize costs.
Design system architecture across multiple network levels including DCS networks, fieldbuses, datalinks to third party devices and cybersecurity requirements.
Plan and perform detailed site survey to collect all required information from site.
Perform input data review and seek necessary clarifications from customer.
Reviewing the Customer Project technical requirements, Specifications and Standards for DCS and C&I packages in order to derive technical scope and solution.
Review field installed devices specifications to identify and select required IO modules types and signal converters.
Review P&IDs and process flow diagrams to plan IO assignments to meet redundancy levels.
Work with application engineers to make sure that software application meets project scope. Review graphics and control strategies.
With help of draftsman, design DCS cabinets of different types, utilizing existing or develop custom designs.
Define the database for all third-party communication data links. Interface with the customer as needed to obtain necessary information.


Procurement and suppliers

Define project detailed Bill of Materials including specifications for Ovation and buyout items.
Work with procurement team to define required buyouts, evaluate and select technical solution and products proposed by vendors.
To interface with vendor technical team in order to derive appropriate technical solution, selection of right product and service and their technical solutions, products and services.


Quality Control

Do quality management for engineering deliverables to make sure it meets company policies.
Conduct internal design reviews which include hardware design, application and control strategies design, network design, cybersecurity compliance, process simulation design, performance calculations design.


Proposals/Sales support

Participate in proposal reviews, consult on technical queries and provide overall support.
Participate in sales meetings to provide technical consultancy and solutions
Perform site walkdowns to support proposal team and define best solution
Estimate engineering hours and required skillset for particular task and project


Basic Qualifications

Degree in Engineering (Instrumentation & Control, Electrical, Electronics, Computer Science) with 5-8 years of experience in industrial process automation projects.

Experience in configuration of automation system based on any reputed PLC/DCS.

Preferred Qualifications

Good knowledge and experience in:

Cisco switches/routers configuration,
Emerson Power and Water Cybersecurity Suite (or equivalent) configuration and site implementation,
Datalink protocols: Modbus RTU/TCP-IP, IEC60870, OPC


Technical Skills/Knowledge Required

Minimum 3-5 years of work experience related to DCS/PLC system engineering activities for Automation of Thermal, Hydro, Gas or Captive Power plants.
Demonstrable work experience in engineering/customer FAT/ commissioning of DCS system for power plants is required.
Thorough understanding of power plant process.
Previous work experience in hardware and/or software engineering of any OEM DCS/PLC system is preferable
Working knowledge of establishing communication/interface with third party system over Modbus, Profibus and other digital communication bus is desirable
Working knowledge of Foundation Fieldbus/Profibus system design, commissioning and troubleshooting is added advantage.
Field commissioning experience related to power plant C&I packages is desirable
Should have proficiency in working with MS office application is must.
Familiarity with AutoCAD tools or Microsoft Visio is added advantage
skills: ['C&I', 'Distributed Control System (DCS)', 'IO', 'Modbus', 'Office Application', 'Process Flow Diagrams', 'RTU', 'Signal', 'Tech-savvy', 'Technical Requirements']

job_desc:
About the job
Job Description Summary In this role, design engineer will be part of the Advanced Mechanical Design team and will contribute to maturation of the compressor technology of the next generation engines. Engineer will own the design of stator hardware of the product and tech maturation rigs. He/ She will also be responsible for analysis support, manufacturing support, and engineering test support. Job Description




Roles And Responsibilities




Execute the design and evaluation of assigned static Hardware adhering to best practices and program requirements
Resolve issues and solve problems related to Hardware design and producibility using engineering principles, design practices and engineering judgement
Utilizes in-depth knowledge of a technical discipline and analytical thinking and technical experience to execute policy/strategy.
Has knowledge of best practices and how own area integrates with others; is aware of the competition and the factors that differentiate them in the market.
Uses some judgment and has some ability to propose different solutions outside of set parameters to address moderately complicated design challenges.
Uses technical experience and analytical thinking. Uses multiple internal and limited external sources outside of own teams to arrive at decisions.
Acts as a resource for colleagues with less experience. May lead small projects with low risks and resource requirements. Explains information; developing skills to bring team members to consensus around topics within field. Conveys performance expectations and may handle sensitive issues.
Provide technical guidance that influences outcomes to other people supporting moderate complexity projects and/or tasks
Demonstrates domain expertise and skills, building depth.
Moderate complexity, component, module or systems level analysis or hardware ownership
Responsible for project planning activities, including work tasks, project scope, schedule, and budget.
Proactively identifies and helps others recognize lessons learned.




Required Qualifications




B. Tech. / M. Tech. / Ph. D. in Mechanical / Aerospace Engineering or equivalent degree
6+ years of relevant experience on design/analyses of gas turbine components.
In-depth understanding of mechanical engineering design & analysis concepts.
Demonstrated ability to own & deliver on program in time with quality.
Strong expertise on FEA packages like ANYS or similar.
Understanding of overall product life cycle...TRL and MRL processes, NPI and beyond.
Strong team player that believes in team success supersedes individual success.
Strong oral and written communication skills.
Ability to document, plan, market and execute programs.
Established project management skills.
Demonstrated ability to work with across multi-disciplinary teams to solve complex problems.




Desired Characteristics




Aviation and Gas turbine domain knowledge.
Demonstrated ability to analyze and resolve problems.
Demonstrated ability to lead NPI, Technology Maturation Projects and teams.
Exposure to Lean and other statistical, digital methodologies for problem solving
Demonstrated ability to work within & across the business teams.




About Us




GE is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Employment decisions are made without regard to race, color, religion, national or ethnic origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, disability, protected veteran status or other characteristics protected by law.




Disclosure of your Gender or Sexual orientation is completely Voluntary and not mandatory.




www.ge.com




Additional Information




Relocation Assistance Provided: Yes
skills: ['Analytical Skills', 'Communication', 'Problem Solving', 'Engineering Design', 'Gas Turbines', 'Hardware Design', 'Interpersonal Skills', 'Mechanical Engineering', 'Multi-disciplinary Teams', 'Written Communication']

Understanding of overall product life cycle...TRL and MRL processes, NPI and beyond.
Strong team player that believes in team success supersedes individual success.
Strong oral and written communication skills.
Ability to document, plan, market and execute programs.
Established project management skills.
Demonstrated ability to work with across multi-disciplinary teams to solve complex problems.




Desired Characteristics




Aviation and Gas turbine domain knowledge.
Demonstrated ability to analyze and resolve problems.
Demonstrated ability to lead NPI, Technology Maturation Projects and teams.
Exposure to Lean and other statistical, digital methodologies for problem solving
Demonstrated ability to work within & across the business teams.




About Us




GE is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Employment decisions are made without regard to race, color, religion, national or ethnic origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, disability, protected veteran status or other characteristics protected by law.




Disclosure of your Gender or Sexual orientation is completely Voluntary and not mandatory.




www.ge.com




Additional Information




Relocation Assistance Provided: Yes

job_desc:
About the job
About Nokia

At Nokia, we create technology that helps the world act together.

As a trusted partner for critical networks, we are committed to innovation and technology leadership across mobile, fixed, and cloud networks. We create value with intellectual property and long-term research, led by the award-winning Nokia Bell Labs.

Adhering to the highest standards of integrity and security, we help build the capabilities needed for a more productive, sustainable, and inclusive world.

Watch our video to discover how we create meaningful interactions to drive human progress.

About Cloud & Network Services

Cloud and Network Services is a leading Nokia business group that offers Network solutions on Core, Business and Enterprise segments, as well as Cloud solutions and Cognitive Services. It is a newly formed business group, that includes most of the former Nokia Software business, Nokia’s enterprise solutions, core network solutions including both voice and packet core, and managed and advanced services from its former Global Services unit. This unit will also act as a delivery channel of certain products from other business groups to enterprise customers. Cloud and Network Services (CNS) will target growth by leveraging the industry transition to cloud-based delivery, network-as-a-service business models, and software-led value creation.

Job Description :

As a R&D Engineer in Analytics Core Services, you will play an important role that provides infrastructure and platform services to our Insights family of analytics products running across a wide variety of hardware, virtualization platforms and cloud providers.

Job Responsibilities, Skills & Competencies:

To Design, develop, test Software Solution with customer first mindset.
To align with design and software coding standards to keep up with the industry quality standards.
Experience with container technologies such as Docker/Kubernetes..
Experience in using open source solutions, any open source contributions would be highly valued
Expereince with Linux based system and VMWare, OpenShift, Public Cloud.
Experience working with one of the public cloud provider (AWS, Google Cloud Platform, Microsoft Azure).
Experience with GitLab, Gerrit and with Continuous Integration (CI) tools, preferably Jenkins


ESSENTIAL SKILLS AND QUALIFICATIONS:

Bachelor’s in Software Engineering, Computer Engineering, Computer Science, or equivalent
At least 3+ years of work experience
Proficiency in at least one software languages (Python/Go)
General understanding of Kubernetes networking technologies, CRDs and Operators
Strong troubleshooting experience with Debugging and Problem Solving skills.
Strong interpersonal and communication skills


COMPETENCIES:

Working in cross-functional matrix organizations.
Problem solving skills with creative and open mind in developing and applying new and innovative approaches.
Excellent communication and presentation skills (English)
Humble and yet assertive in internal and external communication
Possess “Can Do” attitude


Imagine creating technology that has the potential to change the world. Working with us, you will have a positive impact on people’s lives and help to overcome some of the world’s most pressing challenges. We act inclusively and respect the uniqueness of people. At Nokia, employment decisions are made regardless of race, color, national or ethnic origin, religion, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, marital status, disability, protected veteran status or other characteristics protected by law. Nokia culture welcomes people as their true selves. Come create technology that helps the world act together.

Job

Software - Applied R&D Engineer

Primary Location

India-India-Karnataka-Bangalore
skills: ['Problem Solving', 'Coding Standards', 'Debugging', 'External Communications', 'Internal & External Communications', 'Interpersonal Communication', 'Kubernetes', 'Open Mind', 'Research and Development (R&D)', 'Software Coding']

job_desc:
About the job
Candidate should have working experience with AMS Verification on multiple SOC’s or sub-systems. One should have proficiency in AMS simulation environment using Cadence/Synopsys/Mentor tools. Knowledge of digital design techniques, Verilog HDL, and standard RTL coding styles, as well as analog circuit basics, with previous analog design experience a plus. Candidate should be familiar with the concepts of behavioral modeling - both digital (Verilog-D) and analog (Verilog-A or Verilog-AMS). Experience in SV and UVM testbench development/modifications from mixed signal perspective is a plus. Functional knowledge of analog and mixed signal building blocks, such as comparators, op-amps, switched cap circuits, various types of ADCs and DACs, current mirrors, charge pumps, and regulators is expected. Working knowledge of Perl / Skill/ Python/Tcl or other scripting relevant language is a plus. Candidate should have ability to lead a project team, and work collaboratively in a multi-site development environment.




Measurement Criteria:




Behavioral modeling: Verilog, Wreal or SV-RNM -Full
AMS Verification for SoC or IPs -Full
Test plan preparation as per the dynamics of product specifications - Partial
Dealing challenges with AMS methodologies of Cadence: irun/xrun or Synopsys: XA-VCS or Mentor Eldo ADMS -partial
Testcase Debug & proposing new scenarios – N/A
Handling project dynamics on scope, schedule and effort – coming up with alternative verification plans, Mentoring Junior engineer – N/A




Candidate’s profile:




Bachelors with 3+ years or Masters with 2+ years of experience
Analog: functional spec understanding of standard power management blocks, clock circuits and data converters. Loop analysis is an added advantage
HDL/HVL: Verilog/Verilog-ams, SV/UVM added advantage
Tools: Cadence Xcelium + spectre/ Synopsys XA-VCS/ Mentor Eldo ADMS
Automation: Perl/python/shell
Schedule and result oriented execution mindset, flexible in working as per the project scope needs, Exploring and experimentation for continuous methodology improvements




Part of your life. Part of tomorrow.




Infineon is a world leader in semiconductor solutions that make life easier, safer, and greener. Our solutions for efficient energy management, smart mobility, and secure, seamless communications link the real and the digital world.
skills: ['Analog', 'Analog Circuits', 'Cadence Spectre', 'Computer-Aided Design (CAD)', 'Design Engineering', 'Electrical Engineering', 'Mechanical Engineering', 'Product Design', 'Verilog', 'Verilog-AMS']

job_desc:
About the job
RTL Design Engineer of Complex Interface IP, Sr II

Designation: ASIC Digital Design Engr, Sr II

The candidate will be part of the R&D in Solutions Group at our Bangalore Design Center, India.

The position offers learning and growth opportunities. This is a Technical Contributor role

It offers challenges to work in a multi-site environment on complex IP Cores

The role that will include IP Design using latest HDL and design Flows .

Job Responsibilities

Will be working on the next generation USB/DDR/PCIe/Ethernet protocols for commercial, Enterprise and Automotive applications
Understand Standard Specifications/ the functional specifications/ feature enhancements for the product
Create architecture and micro-architecture design documents for complex components of the design
Contribute to the Design Tasks – RTL coding of design, synthesis, CDC compliance, debug, Test development etc
Interact with customers to discuss/ understand customers’ specification requirements, if needed .
The candidate will work in a project and team oriented environment with teams spread across many sites, worldwide.

Must Have BSEE In EE With 6+ Years Of Relevant Experience Or MSEE With 4+ Years Of Relevant Experience In The Following Areas

Understanding of one or more of protocols: Ethernet, DDR, PCIE, USB, MIPI-UFS/UniPro/ SD-MMC/ /USB/AMBA (AMBA2, AXI)
Hands on experience with architecting/ micro-architecture/ detailed design from Functional Specifications.
Must have worked on control path oriented designs like asynchronous FIFO, DMA architectures, SPRAM/ DPRAM interface design, etc.
Hands on experience with Synthesizable Verilog/ System Verilog RTL coding for ASIC designs and Simulation tools
Lint, CDC, Synthesis flow and static timing flows, Formal checking, etc is a must for candidates with design background
Experience with Perforce or similar revision control environment
Knowledge of Perl/Shell scripts.
Exposure to quality processes in the context of IP design and verification is an added advantage
Ability to work/ Prior experience as a Manager or Guide for a small team is a major plus. In addition, the candidate should have good communication skills, should be a team player and own good problem solving skills.
skills: ['Application-Specific Integrated Circuits (ASIC)', 'Digital Designs', 'Functional Specifications', 'MIPI', 'PCIe', 'RTL Coding', 'RTL Design', 'SystemVerilog', 'Technical Architecture', 'Verilog']

job_desc:
About the job
Technical Lead




Qualification




Bachelor's in engineering or equivalent




Responsibility




Project Planning & Setup:




Understand and contribute to resource plan.
Identify appropriate processes based on project landscape.
Identify gaps and advise on improvements if required.
Share inputs in creation of project plan.
Contribute to hardware/software requirement plan.
Understand the test strategy, evaluate the design and identify gaps in the test plans, if any.




Requirement Gathering And Analysis




Analyze functional/non functional requirements and seek clarifications for better understanding of requirements.
Define timeline estimates based on the requirements, complexity and inhouse capability.
Communicate estimates to supervisor for review.
Provide inputs on technical feasibility of requirements.
Identify gaps in requirements.
Share additional requirements identified with supervisor.




Design




Guide team in preparation of technical specification document and review the same.
Break down the base lines requirements into business and functional requirements.
Prepare high level and low level design and share with supervisor for approval.
Identify tools and technologies to be used in the project as well as reusable objects that could be customized for the project.
Share the design document with the functional team post supervisor review.




Coding




Guide team in coding as per design.
Follow coding standards and best practices to check code quality.
Share developed code with supervisor for review.
Rework on the code based on inputs if required.
Perform complex integration.
Guide the developers in identifying, preparing and conducting unit test cases and fixing defects based on results.
Consolidate the test results and share with supervisor.
Provide periodic status update to supervisor and highlight / recommend any changes in design based on challenges faced.
Anticipate unreported defects and raise the same to supervisor.
Conduct technical troubleshooting.
Conduct reviews for codes created by team.




Testing




Coordinate with QA team during the testing phase.
Address queries raised by QA within defined timelines.
Conduct functional / non functional testing if required.
Investigate critical defects and establish need for fixing.
Fix complex defects identified during functional / non functional testing.
Understand the defect impact / criticality and handle accordingly.
Raise issues to leads/QA.
Report defect status as per project standard process within agreed timelines.
Review defect fixes done by team guide them.
Fix defects identified during UAT within agreed timelines.
Share revised code with supervisor for review.
Assist team lead and project manager on estimates around defect fixes.




Deployment & Closure




Conduct allocated transition tasks as per agreed timelines.
Address queries / provide assistance in fixing issues during warranty period.
Provide prompt response during production support.
Fix defects as and when required.
Review defect fixes.
Maintain deployment tracker.
Perform sanity check post deployment to ensure smooth production.
Share activity status with supervisor and highlight concerns if any.




Service Support & Maintenance




Participate in scoping meetings and identify transition requirements for new projects.
Reconfirm requirements with relevant stakeholders.
Freeze SME calendar.
Provide transition activities.
Regularly track progress of transitions through weekly dashboards.
Attend user calls, and capture required information and incident details for logging.
Post information gathering, identify whether the incoming request is a service request or an incident.
Determine urgency and impact of the situation.
Assign appropriate priority to the incident.
Assign the incident to the right stakeholder for a workaround/fix.
Conduct analysis on various incidents that occur frequently Categorize recurring incidents as problems/known errors.
Provide support to resolve these errors.
Initiate change management process.




Knowledge Management




Create specific artifacts for tasks allocated by supervisor.
Share artifact with supervisor for review.
Upload article in the knowledge management repository.
Seek inputs from knowledge repository to resolve problems.
Apply best practices/ learning during development activities.




People Management




Provide support in creation of training courses and supporting artifacts on the training server such as demo, presentation.
Conduct training with the help of academy and mentoring with respect to domain.
Mentor new joiners in EAS function on an ongoing basis.
Provide support to various project managers in identification of training needs of their subordinates.
Provide inputs during goal setting and performance appraisal.




Must Have Skills




S/4HANA EWM




Employee Status : Full Time Employee




Shift : Day Job




Travel : No




Job Posting : Sep 22 2021




About Cognizant




Cognizant (Nasdaq-100: CTSH) is one of the world's leading professional services companies, transforming clients' business, operating and technology models for the digital era. Our unique industry-based, consultative approach helps clients envision, build and run more innovative and efficient businesses. Headquartered in the U.S., Cognizant is ranked 185 on the Fortune 500 and is consistently listed among the most admired companies in the world. Learn how Cognizant helps clients lead with digital at www.cognizant.com or follow us @Cognizant. 00042506121

job_desc:
About the job

Bajaj Auto has been a pioneer in developing powerful, sustainable, and affordable vehicles for over 75 years now. In late, 2019, we started the Urbanite business, as a result of which we were able to launch an EV avatar of our popular, flagship market leader - Chetak. With endless advancement opportunities and an intent to differentiate ourselves in the electric vehicle marketplace, we were focused on developing a specialized talent pool, capable of rolling-out, the first 100% in-house built vehicle, while establishing a fully owned and managed, subsidiary, called Chetak Technology Limited (“CTL”)




Job Title | Software Integration Engineer




Work Location : Akurdi, Pune




Division/Department : Intelligent Systems




Qualification : BE/ BTech/ ME/ Mtech/ MSc in Computer Science/ VLSI/ Embedded/ Electronics (&

Telecommunication)/ Instrumentation & Control from reputed institute

Experience : 5 to 7 years




Role Introduction




• Work closely with the hardware development team to configure CTL proprietary RTOS on a given ECU based

on application need.

• Work on developing these modules in such a way as to be re-usable in multiple projects.

• Develop the overall architecture of the application basis requirements and support basic validation before

handover to function development group.

• Provide support for architecture and debug of vehicle level issues, be required to develop setup for virtual

ECU to aid root cause analysis of vehicle issues.

• Also be responsible for approving production release ECU based on inputs from test & validation group and

FMEA.

• Collaborate closely with functional development, software verification, and release engineers




Key Duties & Responsibilities




• Familiarity with microcontroller-based development using compilers/ debuggers etc.

• Good understanding of embedded C with experience in low level driver development using C.

• Exposure CAN based networks.

• Understanding of RTOS concepts.

• Understanding of Software Development life cycle.

• Exposure to AutoSAR based design philosophy.

• Experience in Functional testing on hardware.

• Familiarity with any scripting language python/Perl/ C#.

• Understanding of how ECU software participates to ensure overall vehicle operation.

• Understanding of control strategies for electrical machines.

• Understanding of control strategies for battery management
skills: ['Computer Science', 'Python (Programming Language)', 'C#', 'Embedded Systems', 'Hardware Development', 'Microcontrollers', 'Perl', 'Real-Time Operating Systems (RTOS)', 'Root Cause Analysis', 'Very-Large-Scale Integration (VLSI)']

• Familiarity with any scripting language python/Perl/ C#.

• Understanding of how ECU software participates to ensure overall vehicle operation.

• Understanding of control strategies for electrical machines.

• Understanding of control strategies for battery management

Company

Qualcomm India Private Limited

10+ years of experience in SoC design
Should have knowledge of AMBA protocols - AXI, AHB, APB, SoC clocking/reset/debug architecture and peripherals like USB, PCIE and SDCC.

job_title: Lead Engineer – Hardware Design and Development
job_desc:
About the job
Job Description

Essential Job Responsibilities

Lead/assist new product development activities such as: Electronic product design with respective circuit design for function, reliability and regulatory needs, peer reviews, product qualification planning and testing; identify and use proven technologies, leverage existing product designs, create original circuit designs, and prepare required test plan/reports, technical documentation like design document, product validation reports etc.
Efficiently able to apply working technology knowledge and industry/company standards to achieve robust product designs in a global team environment.
Able to identify effective module integration to prepare final product and system working
Prepare detailed plans necessary to complete assigned projects and validate same.
Able to understand complete product specifications and review product test plan, Timelines, testing methodology, test environment, risk & mitigation plans and retrospective points.
Provide occasional product technical support through reviewing and approving engineering change notifications, managing, and executing cost savings opportunities, or assisting with the investigation of field applications to ensure product functionality, quality and conformance to various industry standards.
Participate in business unit calls for project reviews and regular updates.
Training and development of direct reports.
Willingness to work flexible hours that works best with the local and remote engineering center(s).


Technical Skills: -

Must Have Skills / Competencies
Have min. 7 to 10+ years of hands-on experience in hardware design, development & validations
Experience with electronics hardware including digital (Regular & highspeed IOs like FI/FO/Counters) and analog circuit design (mA, mV, Volt, RTD IOs) and analysis, microprocessor-based board level design including different peripherals like A/D converters, serial, parallel memory interfacing, should be aware of industrial protocol interface and physical layer signaling for RS485/ Modbus/ Ethernet/ UART/SPI/ I2C and basics of power supplies design (Buck/Boost converters).
Should be able to draw schematic, and guide PCB team for accurate PCB design and layout.
Should be able to prepare BOM, component procurement and able to execute proto development which include prototype verification (Functional, thermal and environmental validations)
Should be able to execute complete EMC validations (trouble shooting and design fixes)
Experience with industrial product certifications
A track record of successful product enhancement/s and release
Good to have Skills / Competencies
Experience with Industrial digital communication interfaces like HART, Fieldbus, Profibus.
Experience with international safety and hazardous location design, including intrinsic safety.
Soft Skills
Self-motivated to lead technical projects/tasks and assumes higher level of responsibility
Provide technical support to team members
Possess strong analytical, problem solving, and decision-making skills
Possess excellent oral and written communication skills
Possess ability to contribute to a global team environment


Education: B.E/ME in Electronics/Electronics and Telecommunication Engineering

About Us

WHY EMERSON

Our Commitment to Our People

Across the globe, we are united by a singular Purpose: We drive innovation that makes the world healthier, safer, smarter, and more sustainable.

We invest in our employees to ensure they have the marketplace knowledge, skills, and competencies to bring this Purpose to life while competing and leading in a global economy.

Our training programs focus on end-to-end development, from onboarding through senior leadership.

Our success is measured by the positive impact we make on people, our communities, and the world through our unwavering focus on environmental, social, and regulatory progress. Learn more about us!

Our Commitment to Diversity, Equity & Inclusion

At Emerson, we are committed to fostering a culture where every employee is valued and respected for their unique experiences and perspectives. We believe a diverse and inclusive work environment contributes to the rich exchange of ideas and diversity of thoughts, that inspires innovation and brings the best solutions to our customers.

This philosophy is fundamental to living our company’s values and our responsibility to leave the world in a better place. Learn more about our Culture & Values and about Diversity, Equity & Inclusion at Emerson .

If you have a disability and are having difficulty accessing or using this website to apply for a position, please contact: idisability.administrator@emerson.com .

About Emerson

Emerson is a leading global technology, software and engineering company providing innovative solutions for customers in industrial, commercial, and residential markets.

Our Automation Solutions business helps process, hybrid and discrete manufacturers maximize production, protect personnel and the environment while optimizing their energy and operating costs.

Our Commercial & Residential Solutions business helps ensure human comfort and health, protect food quality and safety, advance energy efficiency and create sustainable infrastructure.

We help customers in the world’s most essential industries solve the biggest challenges of modern life.

Every day, our global workforce fulfills our unified Purpose and lives out the Values we hold close as an organization: Integrity, Safety & Quality, Support Our People, Customer Focus, Continuous Improvement, Collaboration, and Innovation.

Our Causes – Planet, Humanity, Champion, Inclusion and Future – shape, define and fuel Emerson’s culture while inspiring our innovative spirit and driving our focus.

Whether you’re an established professional looking for a career change, an undergraduate student exploring possibilities, or recently received your master’s degree, you’ll find opportunities with us. Join our team and start your journey today!

No calls or agencies please.

job_title: Manager/Lead Analog Mixed Signal ( AMS ) Verification Engineer
job_desc:
About the job

We are looking for an experienced AMS verification engineer. Does this sound like a good role for you?




Our Silicon Lifecycle Management (SLM) business is all about building next-generation intelligent in-chip sensors, hardware/software capabilities, and analytics to integrate into technology products to manage and improve each semiconductor lifecycle stage. We offer the world’s first full hardware IP, test, and end-to-end analytics to help customers integrate faster, optimize performance/power/area/schedule/yield, and enhance reliability. Meeting the unique challenges posed by various target applications, SLM enables differentiated products to market quickly with reduced risk.




Manager/Lead Analog Mixed Signal Verification Engineers
Location: Bangalore/Hyderabad/other locations can be discussed
Experience : 10yrs to 20yrs
Part of the rapidly expanding Hardware-Analytics and Test (HAT) business unit, a Senior Manager, R&D for Front End and AMS Verification. This technical as well as management leadership position is responsible for HDG’s (Hardware Development Group) AMS Verification design flow and IP front-end integration strategy and methodology, developing and supporting next-generation analog, digital, and mixed-signal IPs, and its management. The candidate will provide technical expertise in the development of the MSIP front end with Digital top methodology. There will need to be an exhaustive AMS Verilog bases verification flow to ensure all blocks are verified for behavior and functionality from top-level integration.
Responsible for AMS Verification and front-end Integration for MSIPs
Will set up the flow for front-end integration
Will set up a team to intercept TQV and other swim lanes for top-level MSIP integrations
Mixed mode simulations with 5x improvement in execution time
Demonstrated experience with AMS Verification and front end Mixed Signal IP
Understanding the latest foundry PDKs and their technical collaterals as required by the Analog & Digital design teams including their usage in FE & BE flows
Thorough knowledge of SOC Design flow
People management expertise, ability to bring good people and lead them




Please share your updated CV with taufiq@synopsys.com or refer those who would like to explore this opportunity.




Inclusion and Diversity are important to us. Synopsys considers all applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, gender, gender identity, age, military veteran status, or disability.

job_desc:
About the job
The Cloud Hardware Infrastructure Engineering Firmware Development team is responsible for design and development of Server and Rack Infrastructure Firmware for Microsoft's online services. We work closely with Microsoft product groups, industry partners and researchers to architect and develop server hardware solutions that meet the requirements for our cloud services platforms at the lowest possible cost of ownership (TCO).

Successful candidates are expected to exhibit some or all of the traits below in this job:

Manage and lead multiple teams of firmware engineers, providing guidance and mentoring to team members.
Define and implement firmware development processes, best practices, and standards across teams.
Ensure the timely delivery of high-quality firmware that meets or exceeds product requirements.
Collaborate with cross-functional cross-geo teams to ensure firmware requirements are properly defined and integrated with hardware and software.
Develop and maintain project schedules and monitor progress against them.
Identify and manage project risks and develop contingency plans as necessary.
Provide regular project status updates to upper management, including progress reports, risk assessments, and resource utilization reports.
Foster a positive and productive work environment encourages open communication, collaboration, and innovation.
Continuously evaluate team performance and implement process improvements as necessary to ensure maximum efficiency and quality.
Passionate about coaching team members and helping them grow.

Responsibilities

The Firmware Manager is responsible for managing multiple teams of firmware engineers who develop and maintain embedded software for a variety of products. The manager will oversee the entire firmware development life cycle from requirements gathering, design, development, testing, and deployment. The Firmware Manager will work closely with cross-functional teams, including hardware engineers, software engineers, and project managers to ensure successful project delivery.

The Firmware Manager role is a critical position within the organization, and requires an individual who is a strong leader, an excellent communicator, and has a deep understanding of firmware development processes and methodologies. The successful candidate will be able to balance technical knowledge with project management skills, and be capable of leading and motivating teams to deliver high-quality firmware on time and within budget.

Customer obsessed

We will learn about our customers and their businesses with a beginner’s mind and then bring solutions that meet their needs. We will be insatiable in our desire to learn from the outside and bring it into Microsoft, while still innovating to surprise and delight our users.

Diverse & inclusive

The world is diverse. We will better serve everyone on the planet by representing everyone on the planet. We will be open to learning our own biases and changing our behaviors, so we can tap into the collective power of everyone at Microsoft. We don’t just value differences, we seek them out, we invite them in. And as a result, our ideas are better, our products are better, and our customers are better served.

One Microsoft

We are a family of individuals united by a single, shared mission. It’s our ability to work together that makes our dreams believable and ultimately achievable. We will build on the ideas of others and collaborate across boundaries to bring the best of Microsoft to our customers as one. We are proud to be part of team Microsoft.

Making a difference

If we commit to being customer obsessed, becoming more diverse and inclusive, and operating as One Microsoft, we will achieve our mission to empower every person and organization on the planet. Beyond that, we will make a difference and find deep meaning in our work. We stand in awe of what humans dare to achieve and are motivated every day to empower others to do more and achieve more through our technology and innovation.

We fundamentally believe that we need a culture founded in a Growth Mindset. It starts with a belief that everyone can grow and develop; that potential is nurtured, not pre-determined; and that anyone can change their mindset.

Qualifications

BS or MS in Computer Science/Engineering or equivalent industry experience
20+ years of professional experience in design/development, integration, validation, or system level debugging in embedded systems
8+ years of professional experience building and/or leading multiple teams.
Collaboration (aligned with team, across teams, across geo locations) and ability to deal with ambiguities.
Strong technical background in embedded systems, firmware development, and programming languages such as C/C++.
Experience managing and leading multiple teams of engineers and coordinating complex projects across multiple teams.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to prioritize and manage multiple tasks simultaneously.
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to work effectively with cross-functional teams, upper management, and external stakeholders.
Experience in Agile/Scrum methodologies is a plus.

Microsoft is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, ancestry, color, family or medical care leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, political affiliation, protected veteran status, race, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by applicable laws, regulations and ordinances. If you need assistance and/or a reasonable accommodation due to a disability during the application or the recruiting process, please send a request via the Accommodation request form.

Benefits/perks listed below may vary depending on the nature of your employment with Microsoft and the country where you work.

job_desc:
About the job

Who we are:

We are a start-up based out of Bengaluru & Delhi NCR. We are engaged in development of next generation missions and technologies (NGM&T) towards future warfare needs of the Indian defence forces. We are undertaking research towards enhancing persistence and autonomy for unmanned vehicles and robotic swarms. NRT’s product development portfolio includes a solar power stratospheric high altitude pseudo satellite (HAPS) unmanned platform and an air/ground launched stand-off autonomous system.




Roles and Responsibilities:

● Developing Electronic Hardware Schematics for Unmanned Aerial Vehicle’s (UAV)

Electrical Power System (EPS).

● Developing Hardware for Power Electronic Converters (DC-DC Converters).

● Developing Hardware for Battery Management Systems (BMS)

● Implementation of EMI/EMC compliant designs.

● Component level calculation for Power Electronic Converter subsystems like Sensing and

Signal Conditioning, Power Switch selection, Reactive components design calculations etc.

● Simulation & testing, HIL.

● Identifying vendors for sourcing certain Electronic components.

● Prepare associated documentation like BOM, Thermal data docs for company records and

design review.

● Performing FMECA.




Candidate must have the following skill set:

● Good knowledge of EMI/EMC compliant design.

● Good knowledge of performance and reliability factors of various electronic components.

● Good knowledge of Electronic Schematics and Electrical power systems.

● Basic knowledge of multi layer PCB Design.

● Knowledge of behavior of Solar PV.

● Knowledge of behavior of Battery Packs.

Software skills:

Candidate should be well versed in handling following software, prior experience is preferable:

● MATLAB/Simulink

● PSIM

● LTSPICE, TINA, Multisim etc.

● Eagle/Altium/Orcad

Good to have skills:

● Exposure to standards such as DO-160

● Experience in the Aerospace, EV or Automotive fields is highly preferred.




Experience Required:

● Masters (Power Electronics/Electronics Engineering) with 3 - 5 Years experience or Bachelors

(Electrical/Electronics Engineering) with 4 - 7 years experience.

● Experience should be in various kinds of circuits targeted for Battery operated, Automotive,

& consumer applications

job_desc:
About the job
Driving Infinite Possibilities Within A Diversified, Global Organization

Title: Lead Systems Engineer

Join a team recognized for leadership, top innovator and diversity

Exciting Leadership Opportunity within the Communication, Navigation and Surveillance (CNS) organization!

The position is for Lead Systems Engineer for Radar group within Communication, Navigation & Surveillance COE at HTS India. Primary responsibilities include,

Be a Lead Systems Engineer of the NPI development project responsible for definition of requirements, architecture, design.
Provide technical support for products - field investigation, application support and factory support
Guide the development process and create artifacts that meet FAA/EASA requirements
Engages with business partners and actively contributes to business growth and innovation.

Devises sustainable growth, competitive and differentiation strategies and promotes innovation across teams. Guides team on innovation, review ideas and ensure they are directed to right person is in the role of Intellectual Property Portfolio Manager. Accountable for QE process, works with technical teams to guide them on technical risks, opportunities and assumptions and arrive at efficient estimates.

Actively engages with key stakeholders and cross functional teams to achieve business objectives, implement best practices. A change agent and a practitioner of organizational initiatives. Works with product engineering managers in US and HTS, to help build technical capabilities in the team with hands on experiences, prototyping on ideas and industry technologies.

Drive the product mindset in team, mentor and inspire junior engineers. Work towards realizing the STRAP priorities and realizing the same in the STRAP period. Anticipates industry trends and actively networks with Industry bodies and associations. Contributes to enhancing Honeywell's sustainable competitive advantage. Leads teams through application of profound or broad product /technical know-how within or across job areas, is cognizant of the latest technology trends in the business.

Few of additional responsibilities: -

NPI - Evaluate and suggest suitable technologies for product development, Work as interface between HTS and Honeywell chief engineers/Fellows and influence technical decisions. Principal author or co-author of multiple project proposals which were selected for funding.
Lead Product Technical Council - Accountable and owner of technical decision during product development. Drive decisions during PDR, CDR and other Compliance Reviews.
Strategic Responsibilities - Lead the technical contributions in the domain and provide inputs to STRAP, GSF and PAC. Drive / Collaborate on regional initiatives and pursuits
Create Competitive Intelligence information, identify the gaps and work towards creating new products / features to make Honeywell offerings competitive.
Plan common capital expenses.
Manage common processes and best practices - Exercise judgment in selecting methods, techniques and evaluation criteria within a related function/field. Generate, evaluate, select and implement solutions which are equal to the industry’s state of the art

HTSIND2022

You Must Have

BE/B.Tech or M.E/M.Tech with atleast 15+ Yrs of experience in AEROSPACE industry in building and certifying products related to CNS (Radar, specifically weather radar, will be an advantage).
Waveform design & analysis, Algorithm & Signal Processing development for Airborne Radar Systems. Good Radar System level Architecture understanding for phased array radars.
Experience in leading technical design and architecture for product development. Lead & drive technical proposals.
Strong written and verbal communication skills with the ability to communicate technical information clearly so that it may be understood by both technical and non-technical individuals
Two or more years of experience in handling a product line or lead systems role driving functional teams.
Demonstrated experience in progressively challenging and Responsible roles.
Must have experience working in Matrix organization structure.

We Value

Understanding of the current product line and technical challenges in Radar product line and to arrive at new solutions through development of prototypes, proof of concepts and creating new pursuits
Experience providing technical leadership to a cross discipline, cross site team
Experience with Configuration Management and Change Request tools like DOORs, Clear Case, Clear Quest, JIRA, BitBucket, Bamboo
Experience with product certification guided by FAA/EASA requirements, DO-160, DO-178 B&C, ARP4754A process compliance
Experience with OEM requirements and development processes
Experience with hardware design, test and troubleshooting.
Demonstrated communication, relationship and team building skills
Action Oriented: Works hard, full of energy; not fearful of acting with best data even if incomplete; seizes opportunities when they arise

Additional Information

Category: Engineering

About the job

Hi All,




We are looking for Experienced Embedded Hardware Engineer




Job Description




• Experience in Schematic and Layout design and review activities. • Good command on Component Selection, Board bring up and Testing activities. • Active collaboration with Cross functional teams. • Should have worked on complete project life cycle. • Generate designs robust in presence of ESD, EMC/EMI and challenging thermal environments. Involved in certification for the industrial product will be the added advantage. • Should be familiar with lab instruments like mustimeters, DSO, Functional generator, CAN, logic analyser. • Excellent problem-solving skills.




Looking for Immediate joiners only.

job_desc:
About the job
Job description:


Architect & lead design, development, implementation, verification, validation & reliability growth of embedded digital electronics based systems & components as applied on downhole & surface equipment/tools as part of drilling, wireline, perforating technologies
Design and analysis of data acquisition systems including A/D, D/A, high speed Microcontrollers, Digital Signal Processors (DSP), FPGA, I/O communications (SPORT, CAN, SPI, I2C, RS485, RS232, Ethernet, etc.), volatile and non-volatile memory.
Integrate motor controller chips, analog products and firmware to deliver overall motor controller functionality.
Develop schematic for digital and mixed signal circuits and board design, including: microcontrollers, processors, memory interfaces, digital interface buses, point of load power distribution. Perform digital system simulation, analysis, and design of high-speed digital circuits. Perform system verification and validation including use of laboratory test equipment and proper probing techniques for circuit development and verification. Perform board level rework to support development and testing. Work with PCB designers to develop PCB layout for high-frequency switching circuits minimizing EMI issues.
Understanding of various motor control methods (Field Oriented/scalar) and its impact to the hardware design.
Utilize commonly used circuit simulators (LTSPICE, PSPICE, etc.)
Utilize math tools (Matlab, MathCAD, etc.)
Work with electrical systems, firmware and mechanical engineers to develop solutions as required for the product.
Present in design reviews of internal developments and review third party designs
Develop component qualification plans and lead execution of plans.
Lead functional and qualification testing of the designed boards and sub-assemblies. Support functional testing for motor controllers on Hardware-in-the-loop simulator, dynamometers and on assembled tool.
Document designs, specifications, test plans, revisions and produce test reports
Lead troubleshooting of boards
Present technical status, risk plans and reports to management
Provide technical guidance and leadership to other personnel in the team in developing new approaches to solve problems.
Prepared to work on several projects at a given time or highly complicated projects that require a creative team work. Work with cross-functional teams during product life-cycle
Excellent organization, interpersonal, leadership, analytical and problem solving skills.
Subject matter expert for Halliburton

A bachelor's degree in electrical engineering, electronics engineering or similar discipline and a minimum of six years related experience are required for the position. A master’s degree or PhD in electrical/electronics engineering with emphasis on digital electronics and license/charter as a Professional Engineer are preferred.



Some travel may be required.



Location: Sai Radhe Building 100 + 101 Kennedy Road, Pune, India





We offer:



We invest in our employees through competitive compensation plans, health benefits, work-life programs, and reward and incentive plans. We have the right people to develop the right technologies and bring innovative solutions to the industry – and we value those people as an unmatched competitive advantage.

About the job
Job description:


Architect & lead design, development, implementation, verification, validation & reliability growth of embedded digital electronics based systems & components as applied on downhole & surface equipment/tools as part of drilling, wireline, perforating technologies
Design and analysis of data acquisition systems including A/D, D/A, high speed Microcontrollers, Digital Signal Processors (DSP), FPGA, I/O communications (SPORT, CAN, SPI, I2C, RS485, RS232, Ethernet, etc.), volatile and non-volatile memory.
Integrate motor controller chips, analog products and firmware to deliver overall motor controller functionality.
Develop schematic for digital and mixed signal circuits and board design, including: microcontrollers, processors, memory interfaces, digital interface buses, point of load power distribution. Perform digital system simulation, analysis, and design of high-speed digital circuits. Perform system verification and validation including use of laboratory test equipment and proper probing techniques for circuit development and verification. Perform board level rework to support development and testing. Work with PCB designers to develop PCB layout for high-frequency switching circuits minimizing EMI issues.
Understanding of various motor control methods (Field Oriented/scalar) and its impact to the hardware design.
Utilize commonly used circuit simulators (LTSPICE, PSPICE, etc.)
Utilize math tools (Matlab, MathCAD, etc.)
Work with electrical systems, firmware and mechanical engineers to develop solutions as required for the product.
Present in design reviews of internal developments and review third party designs
Develop component qualification plans and lead execution of plans.
Lead functional and qualification testing of the designed boards and sub-assemblies. Support functional testing for motor controllers on Hardware-in-the-loop simulator, dynamometers and on assembled tool.
Document designs, specifications, test plans, revisions and produce test reports
Lead troubleshooting of boards
Present technical status, risk plans and reports to management
Provide technical guidance and leadership to other personnel in the team in developing new approaches to solve problems.
Prepared to work on several projects at a given time or highly complicated projects that require a creative team work. Work with cross-functional teams during product life-cycle
Excellent organization, interpersonal, leadership, analytical and problem solving skills.
Subject matter expert for Halliburton

A bachelor's degree in electrical engineering, electronics engineering or similar discipline and a minimum of six years related experience are required for the position. A master’s degree or PhD in electrical/electronics engineering with emphasis on digital electronics and license/charter as a Professional Engineer are preferred.



Some travel may be required.



Location: Sai Radhe Building 100 + 101 Kennedy Road, Pune, India





We offer:



We invest in our employees through competitive compensation plans, health benefits, work-life programs, and reward and incentive plans. We have the right people to develop the right technologies and bring innovative solutions to the industry – and we value those people as an unmatched competitive advantage.
skills: ['Problem Solving', 'Analog', 'Circuit Design', 'Digital Circuit Design', 'Digital Electronics', 'Electronic Engineering', 'Electronics', 'Firmware', 'Qualification Testing', 'Reliability']

job_desc:
About the job
Job Description

Job Title:

Firmware Development Engineer

Location:

EIC-Pune

Position Summary:

As a firmware engineer working in the new product development group you will be responsible for a broad range of engineering tasks. Our mission is to deliver to the market highly reliable products for which Emerson is well known and our customers demand.

In support of that mission you will be responsible for rapid familiarization with embedded products, designing and development of new features, developing firmware for wireless communication like Bluetooth. This role requires a well-rounded skillset with the ability to work within an already defined architecture and the ability to design new architectures. You will be expected to document your work thoroughly and support our commitment to software quality by adhering to company best practices for software development. Design documentation using unambiguous tools such as UML are expected. Your code will be subjected to code reviews and will be required to conform to company coding standards. Unit testing and static analysis are also expected. Your development tasks will span feature design, implementation, verification and release.

This is an exciting opportunity for someone that likes to be continually challenged by working with new and unfamiliar hardware and tools.

Essential Job Functions:

Analyze, design, and implement solutions to requirements
Propose improvements to identified software inefficiencies and deficiencies
Utilize scopes, meters, power sources etc. as necessary to complete the task
Plan and architect a testing environment using existing tool chain for a given product
Participate in sprint planning sessions.
Identifies test cases necessary for verifying firmware requirements.
Implements or manages the implementation of test cases
Manage code changes using version control tools.
Participate in code reviews.
Execute or manage the execution of test cases
Log defects in project defined defect tracking tool
Read and follow relevant project engineering practice and engineering standards documents.


Education / Experience Required:

Bachelor of Science Computer Engineering, Electronics Engineering or Equivalent Engineering with a focus on programming
Prior embedded development experience is a must with ability to understand hardware interfaces and work with hardware engineering team to analyze, troubleshoot technical challenges.
Ability to work in a global engineering environment


Knowledge / Skills / Abilities:

Knowledge and experience with 8, 16, and 32 bit Micro-controllers
Knowledge and experience with agile development methodologies
Knowledge and experience with distributed version control such as (GIT, Mercurial)
Expert programming skills with C / C++ compilers and linkers
Standalone and RTOS based firmware development experience.
Experience developing low level driver interfaces for I2C/SPI/UART/Display/
6-8 years of embedded firmware development experience for an embedded product
Strong analytical and debugging skills
Knowledge or ability to learn requirements management database tools such as (Jama)
Ability to participate in a team environment
Must have a commitment to quality
Methodical problem-solving skills are needed
skills: ['Bluetooth', 'Database Tools', 'Design Documents', 'Firmware', 'Hardware Engineering', 'Mercurial', 'Software Quality', 'Test Cases', 'Unified Modeling Language (UML)', 'Universal Asynchronous Receiver/Transmitter (UART)']

job_desc:
About the job

Qualifications:

B.E: Electrical/Electronic Engineering.
Relevant Exp: 4-10 years

Knowledge, Skills and Abilities:

Essential

Understanding of electric vehicle components like – Motors, Controllers, – Motors, Controllers, – Motors, Controllers, DCDC converters, chargers, batteries, BMS etc.
Requirement generation
Technical feasibility analysis for customer requirements

· Experience in the field of Embedded Systems significantly in the Automotive domain

· Basic Knowledge of Embedded hardware and power electronics

· Knowledge in Design Verification/Validation Planning (DVP)

· Knowledge of FMEA

· Knowledge about Integrity or DOORS.

· Microprocessors and Microcontrollers knowledge

· Hands-on experience with MS Office (Word and Excel), MPP

· Basic Knowledge of communication tools e.g. CANoe, CAN analyser etc

· Hands-on experience with test & measurement equipment such as multi-meters, oscilloscopes, power supplies etc.

· Good command over written English & ability to write technical reports with attention to details.

Desired

Basic Knowledge of HIL tools e.g. NI Labview Veristand
C Programming
Knowledge and experiences in safety related regulations and standards (IEC 61508 or ISO 26262)

Responsibilities:

· Customer requirements analysis during acquisition as well as during product development.

· Generating/Creating System requirements by market survey, benchmarking.

· Architecture development for EV components – Motors, Controllers, DCDC converters, chargers.

· Coordinate with internal domains to prepare technical proposals.

· Primary customer interface for technical topics.

· Support software development, Hardware development, Integration and validation team

· Review of Hardware and Software requirements

· Analysis of customer requirement to derive software and hardware and mechanical design.

· Coordination / conflict resolution (technical)-different domains (SW/HW/MD/Testing)

· Generating EOL and Burn in test specs

· Coordinate with CFT for design transfer to production
skills: ['CANoe', 'Electronic Engineering', 'HIL', 'Hardware Development', 'ISO 26262', 'Mechanical Engineering', 'Requirements Analysis', 'Requirements Gathering', 'System Requirements', 'Systems Engineering']
